thread.title: Stunning photos of rainbows in Mass. following weekend storm
thread.title_full: Stunning photos of rainbows in Mass. following weekend storm

author: Russ Reed
title: Stunning photos of rainbows in Mass. following weekend storm
text: Stunning photos of rainbows in Massachusetts following weekend storm Lu Huang Slideshow 7 photos Advertisement Stunning photos of rainbows in Massachusetts following weekend storm BOSTON â€” A number of viewers told WCVB Channel 5 that they could spot rainbows in the skies above Massachusetts following Saturday afternoon's rain showers that were preceded by a storm that brought Advertisement A number of viewers told WCVB Channel 5 that they could spot rainbows in the skies above Massachusetts following Saturday afternoon's rain showers that were preceded by a storm that brought [rain](https://www.wcvb.com/article/massachusetts-rainfall-totals-january-12-13-2024/46375927), [strong winds](https://www.wcvb.com/article/massachusetts-high-wind-reports-january-13-2024/46372378) and [flooding](https://www.wcvb.com/article/flooding-massachusetts-coast-january-13-2024/46373322) to New England. Some of those viewers shared photos of those rainbows, and several of them were able to capture double rainbows on camera. One of those double rainbows was spotted over Boston's iconic rainbow-colored gas tank along Interstate 93 in Dorchester. "Rainbows are actually circles, but when you view them from the ground, the ground cuts off the bottom part of it," said StormTeam 5 meteorologist A.J. Burnett. "But when you look at them from higher above, you can actually make out an entire circle in some cases."
